text: Hello, Is it possible to make from a Global Module a Local module?

Hello
 I have a query related to this API <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files>.
I got the error *"MISSING_SCOPES"* while using this API <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files>.
I checked the Auth token scope with this <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/access-tokens/{token}> and got the below response
 "{
    "token": "CP6Z-_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxVZL7XtKA25hMVIAWgA",
    "user": "<mailto:akshay.dobariya@ajmerainfotech.com|x>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
    "hub_domain": "<http://app.com|app.com>",
    "scopes": [
        "oauth",
        "files",
        "tickets",
        "files.ui_hidden.read"
    ],
    "hub_id": xxxx,
    "app_id": xxx,
    "expires_in": 1166,

    "token_type": "access"
 } "

Hi all, does anyone know how to stop top of the page banner CTAs (beta) from displaying over the navigation menu on a HubSpot site? Would ideally like it to display above the nav bar but it's not playing ball and there's no option to enable that!
Hey Nick, do you have an example page of this should be pushing down by default?
Hi Conor, I've got it currently set to the footer for now after 10% scroll but it's the same concept I guess!?<https://thoughtriver.com>
oh thanks <@U05KESBSAJ0> i will check it :wink:

Ah it’s cause the nav is fixed. We push down our banner when it’s set to be the top one, but the fixed nav is overlaying that.

One thing you could do is add an offset to the top nav of the size of the banner and they’d both be displayed, we add in a fake div to offset so noting would be hidden on the page

Example I’ve offset the top banner by 75px there and they both display.

Would have to remove when cta is dismissed.

Could also change nav to be absolute positioned and relative to the body-wrapper div since we push down outside of that

Hey Thomas, do you still have it? I am
interested. let me know.
Maybe there's a better way.. but for this I would just create a new local module and copy/paste over module HTML/CSS/JS
Hi all, is there a way to install and import another library from those allowed in a custom code action in a workflow?

Anyone know if it's possible to add a year to a date property with an advanced calculated formula? haven't been able to figure out the syntax, if so. For example take 08/31/2023 and set it to 08/31/2024

Hi everyone :wave:
Has anyone encountered the following issue?
I need to import some JS libraries that are using the double curly braces `{{` and `}}`  in their codebase.
Whenever I run the `hs upload`  command it fails:
```[HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] Uploading website-theme-dev/js/main.js failed
[HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] Error validating template.```
What is the proper way to handle that kind of issue?
Cheers
